contactMethods.title: Using Email
contactMethods.description: A tried and true (to the golden age of self-hosted websites) method of communication.

contactMethods.title: Using Matrix
contactMethods.description: A new way of instant messaging, quite similar to email actually.

contactMethods.title: Using GitHub
contactMethods.description: Not really a way to contact me, but you might just want to checkout the source for something.

technologies.title: Node.js
technologies.description: The first solution to use JavaScript server-side. It powers many production websites like Apple, Twitter, and more.

technologies.title: TypeScript
technologies.description: Type safe and can be compiled into JavaScript to be used anywhere.

technologies.title: React
technologies.description: React is a frontend JavaScript library that allows for very flexible and extendable web apps.

technologies.title: Next.js
technologies.description: A framework to use React for high traffic, production web applications.

technologies.title: 11ty
technologies.description: Simple static site generator. Runs this site, and many others. ;3

technologies.title: Deno
technologies.description: A next generation JavaScript and TypeScript interpreter like Node.js, but written in rust using the V8 engine. It aims to be fully compatible with browsers and Node.

technologies.title: Redis
technologies.description: A fast, extendable, in memory, database. Mainly used as a cache; but can be used as a primary database.

technologies.title: Python
technologies.description: Really fast and powerful interpreted programming/scripting language

technologies.title: Rust
technologies.description: Memory-safe, low-level programming language with FFI support and a great compiler and community.

technologies.title: Tokio
technologies.description: Asynchronous processing library for rust that implements modern paradigms and conventions.

technologies.title: Warp
technologies.description: Advanced http(s) server library for rust, built on tokio.

technologies.title: Linux
technologies.description: Open source operating system that we use full time on all our bare metal machines (specifially: NixOS).

technologies.title: Ghidra
technologies.description: Open source reverse engineering framework, primarily maintained by the NSA.

technologies.title: Docker
technologies.description: Containerized application build, distribution, and run system.
